intro: Soldanella × janchenii, commonly known as the hybrid snowdrop, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white and pale yellow. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland or alpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
